update.description:
**Motivation**

Trivial Physics Engine \(TPE\)

1. motivation: we aren't trying to simulate the robots themselves; those are developed by the robot vendors. Instead, we want to simulate and test the higher-order fleet dynamics, sequencing of the elevators and doors, etc.
2. represent entities as 3D points \(x, y, z and roll, pitch, yaw\)
3. no need for continuous Z
4. no need for real physics \(or even real kinematics\)
5. need to detect "conflicts" where bounding boxes/circles intersect, but don't need to model the collisions or contacts in a physically realistic manner

**Goal**

Support fast simulation of 3D \(~2.5D\) world with a minimum set of kinematics related features. It will be interfaced with ign-gazebo, and be loaded as an alternative custom physics engine to `dartsim`.

**Architecture**

TPE Entities \(Entity.hh\)

* Engine
* World
* Model
* Link
* Collision
* Shape\(box, cylinder, sphere and mesh\)

TPE FeatureList

* FeaturePolicy3D
* EntityManagementFeatureList
* SimulationFeatureList
* SDFFeatureList
* ShapeFeatureList

**Implementation Assumptions**

* There is only one engine
* There is only one world per engine
* No constraints 
* No forces or torques
* No canonical link, groupID ~= modelID
* dartsim::shapeID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID
* dartsim::\_boxID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID

‌
update.title: [WIP][Citadel] Trivial physics engine
update.reason: only one PR #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/129  left to merge, no need for record-keeping anymore

content.raw:
I have updated the folder structure according to @{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9} 's suggestion, but have not updated the `CMakeLists.txt` files. I’m thinking about open a new PR focusing on updating all `CMakeLists.txt` files, then open two PRs of `lib` and `plugin` branching off the `CMakeLists.txt` PR. Eventually, this PR \(#124\) will be closed and only serve record-keeping purpose.

All PRs will be merged in the following order:

\[Updated\]

PR1. base branch: `ign-physics2`

* `tpe_cmakelists_citadel` → `ign-physics2`
* PR: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/125](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/125)
* branch: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe\_cmakelists\_citadel?dest=ign-physics2#diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe_cmakelists_citadel?dest=ign-physics2#diff)

PR2. base branch: `tpe_cmakelists_citadel`

* `tpe_lib_citadel` → `ign-physics2`
* PR: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/126](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/126/citadel-tpe-lib)
* branch: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe\_lib\_citadel?dest=tpe\_cmakelists\_citadel#diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe_lib_citadel?dest=tpe_cmakelists_citadel#diff)

PR3. base branch: `tpe_lib_citadel`

* `tpe_plugin_citadel` → `ign-physics2`
* PR: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/129/citadel-tpe-plugin](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/129/citadel-tpe-plugin)
* branch: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe\_plugin\_citadel?dest=ign-physics2](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/branch/tpe_plugin_citadel?dest=ign-physics2)

content.raw: I completely agree with this. There shouldn’t be any need to install the headers, and therefore it should’t be done.
content.html: I completely agree with this. There shouldn’t be any need to install the headers, and therefore it should’t be done.

content.raw:
Sure, there’s nothing inherently wrong with having the TPE library be a component of `ign-physics`.

The only reason to avoid that is if we want the TPE to be usable independently of `ign-physics`, in which case we should probably put it into its own repo entirely. But so long as it’s nested within the `ign-physics` repo, I think it’s sensible to just let it be a “component” library.
content.html:
Sure, there’s nothing inherently wrong with having the TPE library be a component of ign-physics.

The only reason to avoid that is if we want the TPE to be usable independently of ign-physics, in which case we should probably put it into its own repo entirely. But so long as it’s nested within the ign-physics repo, I think it’s sensible to just let it be a “component” library.

content.raw: we should consider not installing the tpe header files in `lib` so we don't have to ensure API/ABI stability
content.html: we should consider not installing the tpe header files in lib so we don't have to ensure API/ABI stability

**Motivation**

Trivial Physics Engine \(TPE\)

1. motivation: we aren't trying to simulate the robots themselves; those are developed by the robot vendors. Instead, we want to simulate and test the higher-order fleet dynamics, sequencing of the elevators and doors, etc.
2. represent entities as 3D points \(x, y, z and roll, pitch, yaw\)
3. no need for continuous Z
4. no need for real physics \(or even real kinematics\)
5. need to detect "conflicts" where bounding boxes/circles intersect, but don't need to model the collisions or contacts in a physically realistic manner

**Goal**

Support fast simulation of 3D \(~2.5D\) world with a minimum set of kinematics related features. It will be interfaced with ign-gazebo, and be loaded as an alternative custom physics engine to `dartsim`.

* World

update.title: [WIP][Citadel] Trivial physics engine

content.raw:
The proposed directory looks good to me.  

One question, the current TPE library is added as a `component` of ign-physics. Is that ok?
content.html:
The proposed directory looks good to me.

One question, the current TPE library is added as a component of ign-physics. Is that ok?

content.raw:
I think there may have been some confusion about the motivation of the `dartsim/include` directory. The only reason it was created was to illustrate how it’s possible for physics engines to extend the physics plugin features beyond the feature set that’s explicitly declared upstream in `ignition-physics`. There’s actually no need at all for it to exist, nor do we need `tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh` to exist. All the headers and source files for the TPE plugin can just go into a single source directory.

I’m seeing that the TPE was implemented as its own library, and then the plugin was made to be a light wrapper around it. I wasn’t expecting that \(I figured the TPE would be trivial enough to just implement the whole thing inside the plugin itself\), but I think it’s a good approach.

Personally the structure that I’d recommend would be:

```
tpe/CMakeLists.txt # just does add_subdirectory(lib) add_subdirectory(plugin)
tpe/lib/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/lib/src/*
tpe/lib/include/ignition/physics/tpe/*
tpe/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/plugin/src/*
```

For line \(4\) I’m concerned that `/usr/include/tpe` would be at risk for a name collision, so I’d recommend nesting it inside of `/usr/include/ignition/physics/tpe`.

There’s no need for a `tpe/plugin/include` because I can’t imagine that the TPE would want to offer any features beyond what’s pre-defined in `ignition-physics`.
content.html:
I think there may have been some confusion about the motivation of the dartsim/include directory. The only reason it was created was to illustrate how it’s possible for physics engines to extend the physics plugin features beyond the feature set that’s explicitly declared upstream in ignition-physics. There’s actually no need at all for it to exist, nor do we need tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh to exist. All the headers and source files for the TPE plugin can just go into a single source directory.

I’m seeing that the TPE was implemented as its own library, and then the plugin was made to be a light wrapper around it. I wasn’t expecting that (I figured the TPE would be trivial enough to just implement the whole thing inside the plugin itself), but I think it’s a good approach.

Personally the structure that I’d recommend would be:

tpe/CMakeLists.txt # just does add_subdirectory(lib) add_subdirectory(plugin)
tpe/lib/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/lib/src/*
tpe/lib/include/ignition/physics/tpe/*
tpe/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpe/plugin/src/*

For line (4) I’m concerned that /usr/include/tpe would be at risk for a name collision, so I’d recommend nesting it inside of /usr/include/ignition/physics/tpe.

There’s no need for a tpe/plugin/include because I can’t imagine that the TPE would want to offer any features beyond what’s pre-defined in ignition-physics.

content.raw: Another one to consider: `tpe-plugin` instead of `tpesim-plugin`.
content.html: Another one to consider: tpe-plugin instead of tpesim-plugin.

content.raw:
or maybe:

~~~
tpesim-plugin/
tpesim-plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpesim-plugin/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh
tpesim-plugin/src/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/include/tpesim/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/src/*
~~~

and the bulk of the header files would go to `/usr/include/tpesim` instead of `/usr/include/ignition/physics/tpesim`
content.html:
or maybe:

tpesim-plugin/
tpesim-plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpesim-plugin/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/World.hh
tpesim-plugin/src/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/include/tpesim/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/src/*

and the bulk of the header files would go to /usr/include/tpesim instead of /usr/include/ignition/physics/tpesim

content.raw:
I think it would be more clear to me if the folder structure was like the following:

~~~
tpesim-plugin/
tpesim-plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpesim-plugin/include/ignition/physics/tpesim-features/World.hh
tpesim-plugin/src/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/src/*
~~~

I know this differs from the folder structure of dartsim, but it seems more clear to me. I'm not sure if we would be able to restructure the dartsim folder in a similar way without changing cmake component / target names.

cc @{557058:67759e29-d1df-465f-868d-047738e36fc9}
content.html:
I think it would be more clear to me if the folder structure was like the following:

tpesim-plugin/
tpesim-plugin/CMakeLists.txt
tpesim-plugin/include/ignition/physics/tpesim-features/World.hh
tpesim-plugin/src/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/include/ignition/physics/tpesim/*
tpesim-plugin/tpesim/src/*

I know this differs from the folder structure of dartsim, but it seems more clear to me. I'm not sure if we would be able to restructure the dartsim folder in a similar way without changing cmake component / target names.

cc @Michael Grey

content.raw: All the test cases have been added and I believe this PR is ready for early stage reviews. I’m thinking about moving `TPE` to a separate PR but not sure in what way \(a folder in physics or its own repo etc.\) Any suggestions are appreciated!
content.html: All the test cases have been added and I believe this PR is ready for early stage reviews. I’m thinking about moving TPE to a separate PR but not sure in what way (a folder in physics or its own repo etc.) Any suggestions are appreciated!

content.raw: sounds good! I’ll get on it now.
content.html: sounds good! I’ll get on it now.

content.raw: We can split this PR into smaller parts for easier review. For example, the very first part would just be the cmake changes adding the tpesim component. After that, we can create PR for the `tpe` classes, then features, etc
content.html: We can split this PR into smaller parts for easier review. For example, the very first part would just be the cmake changes adding the tpesim component. After that, we can create PR for the tpe classes, then features, etc

update.description:
**Motivation**

Trivial Physics Engine \(TPE\)

1. motivation: we aren't trying to simulate the robots themselves; those are developed by the robot vendors. Instead, we want to simulate and test the higher-order fleet dynamics, sequencing of the elevators and doors, etc.
2. represent entities as 3D points \(x, y, z and roll, pitch, yaw\)
3. no need for continuous Z
4. no need for real physics \(or even real kinematics\)
5. need to detect "conflicts" where bounding boxes/circles intersect, but don't need to model the collisions or contacts in a physically realistic manner

**Goal**

Support fast simulation of 3D \(~2.5D\) world with a minimum set of kinematics related features. It will be interfaced with ign-gazebo, and be loaded as an alternative custom physics engine to `dartsim`.

**Architecture**

TPE Entities \(Entity.hh\)

* Engine
* World
* Model
* Link
* Collision
* Shape\(box, cylinder, sphere and mesh\)

TPE FeatureList

* FeaturePolicy3D
* EntityManagementFeatureList
* SimulationFeatureList
* SDFFeatureList
* ShapeFeatureList

**Implementation Assumptions**

* There is only one engine
* There is only one world per engine
* No constraints 
* No forces or torques
* No canonical link, groupID ~= modelID
* dartsim::shapeID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID
* dartsim::\_boxID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID

‌

update.description:
**Motivation**

No existing physics engine inside Ignition that is fast \(large timesteps ~0.1s\) enough to simulate and test the higher-order fleet dynamics without real physics and multi-machine simulation/synchronization. 

**Goal**

Support fast simulation of 3D \(~2.5D\) world with a minimum set of kinematics related features. It will be interfaced with ign-gazebo, and be loaded as an alternative custom physics engine to `dartsim`.

**Architecture**

TPE Entities \(Entity.hh\)

* Engine
* World
* Model 
* Link
* Collision
* Shape\(box, cylinder, sphere and mesh\)

TPE FeatureList

* FeaturePolicy3D
* EntityManagementFeatureList
* SimulationFeatureList
* SDFFeatureList
* ShapeFeatureList

**Implementation Assumptions**

* There is only one engine
* There is only one world per engine
* No constraints 
* No forces or torques
* No canonical link, groupID ~= modelID
* dartsim::shapeID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID
* dartsim::\_boxID ~= tpesim::\_collisionID

‌
